info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 7:21PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTH CENTRAL WHEATLAND AND NORTH CENTRAL SWEET GRASS COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM MDT... At 719 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 19 miles south of Harlowton, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail as well as torrential rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Melville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
